node.title: Less than 16% of the world's coastal regions remain intact, study says
node.description: The research found that more than half of the United States' coastal regions are under very high levels of human industrial pressure.

node.title: Eminem takes a knee during Super Bowl halftime show
node.description: While performing his classic hit "Lose Yourself" on Sunday night, the 15-time Grammy winner got on his knee and held his head.

node.title: New Zealander jailed for child sex abuse charges in US
node.description: A 28-year-old New Zealander has been jailed for 21 years in the United States for producing child sexual abuse material.

node.title: Auckland Mayor Phil Goff announces he will retire from politics
node.description: Auckland Mayor Phil Goff will retire from politics and says he will not be seeking re-election this year.

node.title: ‘Billions’ Season 6, Episode 4 Recap: Hungry Like the Wolf
node.description: Prince makes Kate an offer she can refuse. It’s just really hard to.

node.title: The ethereal Gabriella Papadakis and Guillaume Cizeron have a hefty edge.
node.description: By Jeré Longman

node.title: Right to protest lost for those who 'threaten, harass and disrupt', Robertson says
node.description: Deputy Prime Minister Grant Robertson says although people have a right to protest when "they threaten, harass and disrupt people and a whole city they lose that right".

node.title: Unvaccinated US man planning trip to NZ with illegally-obtained certificate
node.description: An unvaccinated man plans on travelling to New Zealand - and there's no way to tell he hasn't had the jab.

node.title: Biden criticizes NFL for lack of Black head coaches during Super Bowl interview
node.description: "It's not a requirement of law, but it's a requirement I think of just some generic decency," the president said.

node.title: Ron Brierley released from jail early due to declining health
node.description: Ron Brierley has been released from Sydney's Long Bay jail without having to serve his full original sentence.

node.title: U.S. preparing to withdraw all personnel from Ukraine capital within 48 hours, sources say
node.description: The U.S. has threatened massive economic and political consequences if Russia invades Ukraine.

node.title: American Airlines flight diverted due to "unruly passenger"
node.description: The flight attendant's union said the passenger tried to open a door.

node.title: '90's hits shine bright at the 2022 Super Bowl LVI halftime show
node.description: A group of iconic performers brought back to the 90s to the 2022 Super Bowl halftime show.

node.title: Labour market favours jobseekers, despite drop in job listings - report
node.description: The labour market is expected to remain tight over the remainder of the year, despite a drop in job growth.

node.title: Covid-19: 'It's likely the virus is in our community' - Cook Islands PM
node.description: There may be "silent transmission" of Covid-19 in Rarotonga after a person tested positive upon arriving back in New Zealand, Cook Islands Prime Minister Mark Brown says.

node.title: L.A. Rams hold lead over Cincinnati Bengals at Super Bowl halftime
node.description: Los Angeles Rams receiver Odell Beckham Jr. suffered an injury to his left leg on a noncontact play with 3:50 remaining in the second quarter.

node.title: Food prices have biggest annual rise in more than a decade
node.description: Food prices in January were 5.9 percent higher than they were the same month a year ago.

node.title: Contact Energy posts significant increase in half-year profit
node.description: A lift in hydro generation, lower costs and higher sales has seen the country's largest power company significantly increase its half-year profit.

node.title: Daily case numbers not showing extent of Omicron spread - Baker
node.description: Epidemiologist Michael Baker is warning the number of Covid-19 cases could be as much as 10 times the official figures. Audio

node.title: Effects of climate change taking root in the wine industry
node.description: Climate change is jolting the wine industry. Lesley Stahl reports on how the economics, practices and in some cases even the flavors of wine are being altered by our shifting climate.

node.title: Publicly listed companies expected to deliver mixed earnings results
node.description: Publicly listed companies are expected to deliver a mixed bag of earnings results depending on their exposure to Covid-related disruptions and cautious outlooks for the rest of the year.

node.title: Ocean carbon sinks could play critical role in stabilising planet
node.description: Comment - We think of trees and soil as carbon sinks, but the world's oceans hold far larger carbon stocks and are more effective at storing carbon permanently.

node.title: Dwayne Johnson gets the crowd energized.
node.description: The actor took to the field right before kickoff.

node.title: Covid-19: Many NZers likely to encounter virus in coming weeks - expert
node.description: Experts are urging those eligible for a Covid-19 booster vaccine to get their shot as soon as possible after a near-doubling of daily Covid-19 case numbers.

node.title: Communication with protesters difficult but negotiators making progress - Police boss
node.description: Police have crack negotiators on the job trying to end the occupation of Parliament's grounds, Wellington's police district commander says. Audio

node.title: New fund targets 20,000 nurses who have left profession
node.description: The Health Ministry has launched a $1 million fund to attract former nurses back to the profession in the pandemic.

node.title: Fleming grabs Black Caps for IPL
node.description: The Stephen Fleming coached Chennai Super Kings have grabbed three Black Caps on the second day of the Indian Premier League auction in Bangalore.

node.title: The Week in Politics: Protest overshadows Parliament's first week
node.description: Analysis - A "reset" National Party takes on the government during Parliament's first week, but protests outside on the grounds dominate the media; and another poll shows National gaining ground.

node.title: Covid-19: School mask mandate tricky for some
node.description: Principals say some schools and teachers are ignoring or misinterpreting the mask mandate for school children.

node.title: New Black Ferns contracts unveiled
node.description: After more than ten years juggling work and training commitment the country's top female rugby players will be able to behind their day jobs to focus on rugby.
